com.navis.framework.portal.cache

Interface ICacheBasedFinder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICacheBasedWorkFinder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCacheBasedFinder, CacheBasedWorkFinder

    public interface ICacheBasedFinder
    This interface uses cache to find results TODO the static methods in here should be moved to a class similar to HibernateApi, say CacheApi
    Author:
    Arvinder Brar, 2016-02-08

      • findValues

        @NotNull
static java.util.List<ValueHolder> findValues(@NotNull
                                                        UserContext inUserContext,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        MessageCollector inOutMc,
                                                        @Nullable
                                                        PredicateIntf inPredicate,
                                                        @Nullable
                                                        java.lang.Long inMaxResults,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        java.util.Collection<ValueHolder> inCacheValues,
                                                        @Nullable
                                                        Ordering... inOrderings)
        Finds values from the cache for entity name. A BizFailure is thrown if the entity name is not one of the supported entities
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message colector
        inPredicate - predicate to be applied to cached objects
        inMaxResults - max results to be returned
        inCacheValues - cache values
        inOrderings - orderings to be applied
        Returns:
        filtered and sorted value holder list

      • findCount

        static int findCount(@NotNull
                     UserContext inUserContext,
                     @NotNull
                     MessageCollector inOutMc,
                     @NotNull
                     PredicateIntf inPredicate,
                     @NotNull
                     java.util.Collection<ValueHolder> inCacheValues)
        Finds the count of objects satisfying the predicate. A BizFailure is thrown if the entity name is not one of the supported entities
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message colector
        inPredicate - predicate to be applied to cached objects
        inCacheValues - cache values
        Returns:
        count of objects satisfying the predicate

      • findValuesByDomainQuery

        @NotNull
java.util.List<ValueHolder> findValuesByDomainQuery(@NotNull
                                                              UserContext inUserContext,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              MessageCollector inOutMc,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              DomainQuery inDomainQuery)
        Finds values by using the domain query object. Please note that all the domain query operations are not supported. Only the follwing are supported at this time 1. Predicates 2. Ordering 3. Max results. The returned results are very sensitive to fields which are cached. If a predicate has a field which is not a cached field no rsults are returned. The caller has to ensure that the predicates only contain fields from cache. The domain query fields are not taken intot account at this time, all the cached fields are returned as part of the value object
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message colector
        inDomainQuery - domain query
        Returns:
        list of value holders

      • findValuesByDomainQuery

        @NotNull
static java.util.List<ValueHolder> findValuesByDomainQuery(@NotNull
                                                                     UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                     @NotNull
                                                                     MessageCollector inOutMc,
                                                                     @NotNull
                                                                     DomainQuery inDomainQuery,
                                                                     @NotNull
                                                                     java.util.Collection<ValueHolder> inCacheValues)
        Finds values by using the domain query object. Please note that all the domain query operations are not supported. Only the follwing are supported at this time 1. Predicates 2. Ordering 3. Max results. The returned results are very sensitive to fields which are cached. If a predicate has a field which is not a cached field no rsults are returned. The caller has to ensure that the predicates only contain fields from cache. The domain query fields are not taken intot account at this time, all the cached fields are returned as part of the value object
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message colector
        inDomainQuery - domain query
        inCacheValues - cache values
        Returns:
        list of value holders
